byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar, Fazal Muzhary and Ahmad Shakib contributed reporting.

abstract: Afghan Parliament passes bill to cap number of wedding guests at 500 people; measure reflects wedding-crashing problem that can burden young men with years of debt after hundreds arrive at their receptions uninvited; local culture obligates men to feed all who arrive.
lead_paragraph: Strangers seeking banquet fare arrive in droves as many seem to know this saying: “With a wedding every night, there is no need to go hungry.”

headline.main: At Afghan Weddings, His Side, Her Side and 600 Strangers
headline.print_headline: His Side, Her Side and 600 Strangers

snippet: Strangers seeking banquet fare arrive in droves as many seem to know this saying: “With a wedding every night, there is no need to go hungry.”
